Brooklyn Historical Society
Brooklyn Historical Society mixed ephemera collection
Brooklyn Historical Society
ARC.314
2 linear feet in 2 record cartons
1783-1994 Materials are in English This collection contains pamphlets, brochures, playbills, catalogs, programs and other materials dating from 1783 to 1994 and relating to a range of individuals, families, and institutions from Brooklyn, Long Island and the Hudson Valley region. The collection was compiled by library staff at the Brooklyn Historical Society.
Arrangement
This collection has been arranged in alphabetical order by folder title.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Conditions Governing Use
All items published prior to 1923 are in the public domain. The copyright status for all other items has not been evaluated. Please consult library staff for more information.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Immediate source of acquisition unknown. This collection was artifically compiled by Brooklyn Historical Society staff.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Historical Society mixed ephemera collection, ARC.314, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of materials dating from 1783 to 1994. The majority of the items are the product of institutions â€“ i.e. businesses, churches, municipal services - though there are a few booklets by individuals, and one hand-drawn family tree. Topics range from advertisements to invitations to fundraising balls to a treatise on human perfectibility. This is a varied collection of disparate materials which were previously part of the Brooklyn Historical Society vertical files.
Biographical / Historical
This collection was compiled by Brooklyn Historical Society staff. These materials were previously part of the BHS vertical files collection, but were physcially removed from vertical files at an unknown date.
